message_1: How many ways can you choose a committee of 3 people from a group of 6 people?
message_2:
To choose a committee of 3 people from a group of 6 people, we use the combination formula, which is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of people (6 in this case) and k is the number of people we want to choose (3 in this case). The exclamation mark denotes the factorial of a number.

C(6, 3) = 6! / (3!(6-3)!)

C(6, 3) = 6! / (3!3!)

C(6, 3) = (6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((3 × 2 × 1)(3 × 2 × 1))

C(6, 3) = (720) / (6 × 6)

C(6, 3) = 720 / 36

C(6, 3) = 20

So, there are 20 ways to choose a committee of 3 people from a group of 6 people.
